Title: "The Song of the Solitary Statesman"

Midwinter morning, a prime minister primes,
at the edge of a landmark, lost in time.
A desperate man, down to his last dime,
throwing dice into the Wind of Chimes.
Howling, not wild, but with a rhythm, a rhyme,
A sad mini-man in life's pantomime.
Tough as Rish! he stands, in the frosty clime,
hard to define, yet, in dreams, sublime.
